item.title: Vyvx and Genesis Offer Worldwide Video Transport
item.description:
The Power of Fiber for Video Transport Those working in video production, distribution, news, or sports broadcasting need reliable video transport. While satellites have been the traditional choice, fiber optic networks offer compelling advantages, including vast bandwidth, minimal latency, and accessibility in popular locations. The Level 3 and Global Crossing merger brought together their video transport expertise, resulting in a comprehensive range of services. Level 3’s Emmy Award-winning Vyvx service provides broadcast fiber services, managed video networks, teleport and satellite services, and venue-specific services...

item.title: The Coming Level 3 Global Crossing Juggernaut
item.description:
The future of business hinges on strong global connections, and the merger of Level 3 Communications and Global Crossing aims to deliver just that. By combining their infrastructure, they’re creating a network with a truly global reach. This $2 billion acquisition will see their combined fiber optic network reach 70 countries across three continents. Level 3 brings a robust US network with long-haul and metropolitan fiber, plus transatlantic cables connecting major US and European cities with low latency...

item.title: Level 3 Vyvx Connects The Super Bowl
item.description:
Super Bowl Sunday is a time for celebration, but behind the scenes, technology ensures a seamless broadcast experience for millions. Level 3 Vyvx VenueNet+ plays a crucial role in delivering high-quality broadcasts from stadiums like Indianapolis’s Lucas Oil Stadium, where their technology is pre-installed and managed by experts. Remote broadcasting, whether for radio or TV, can be unpredictable. Traditional methods often involve cumbersome equipment and potential signal disruptions.
